result.execSummary:
The defendant Aysha Lasha Gross was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carrying Concealed Weapon. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered a forfeiture in the amount of $120 inclusive of costs, to be paid on a payment plan of $40 per month commencing 11/28/2022.  Failure to pay will result in civil forfeiture/tax intercept.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Aysha Lasha Gross

records.addlTxt: See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.

Defendant Aysha Lasha Gross in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Aysha Lasha Gross.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held.Case in court for  Pretrial Conference.  Parties held negotiations off the record.  
Negotiations placed on the record. Upon the motion of the County. Court ordered charge amended to Carry Concealed Weapon, Sec. 63.015, County Ordinance, to which Defendant plead no contest. Defendant found guilty of amended charge. Court ordered a forfeiture in the amount of $120 inclusive of costs, to be paid on a payment plan of $40 per month commencing 11/28/2022.  Failure to pay will result in civil forfeiture/tax intercept.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 30th, 2022

Defendant Aysha Lasha Gross in court.  Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court for Aysha Lasha Gross.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Discussion held regarding status of case and pretrial services reports.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Aysha Lasha Gross in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aysha Lasha Gross appeared by video means with Attorney.
For reasons set forth in the record, defense counsel requests additional time.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Status conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Aysha Lasha Gross in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aysha Lasha Gross appeared by video means with Attorney. Attorney Rosenthal informed the Court he was recently appointed and had incorrect contact information for the defendant. Defendant provided Attorney Rosenthal with contact information.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Aysha Lasha Gross in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Aysha Lasha Gross in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aysha Lasha Gross appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
